instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/1HCWI8T.jpg[/img]


AXG sensor failed, - <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> looks clean. <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> area looks clean

CPU highside sensor failed -

Pbus sensor error - some liquid got here. i've replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>, no change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> has been replaced initially, would make sense to replace <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>. i dont have <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> from 3023 donor board in-stock. Can i use one from 3435 donor board?

found a small green shit on <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>. so i've replaced.
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/LsBsRfU.jpg[/IMG]
 


AXG sensor is fixed.


i bet its SMC, i need to replace.  reflowed but no change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
Idk off top, more likely than not. Check the part numbers on schematic against each other. 

See what Duke has to say before replacing, it may be something simple.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
VP0R will be corrosion on <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>. 
VC1R is not common, measure on <RESISTOR>R5320</RESISTOR>. Check in hardware profile to see what the limits of the sensor are, will give a clue as where to look.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>, still no change. i'll try again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
thank you, i didn't know i can read voltages in Hardware profile.



[SIZE=14px][B]This board:[/B][/SIZE]

has to be smc.
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/FfCB9dD.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: Are all voltage reading slightly low? Could be the reference voltage for the SMC is off. AVREF comes from <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
changed <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, made no differences.

is it normal for this model. it always power on with a charged battery then plug a charger?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:

8.38v with charger, no battery
7.63v with battery and charger.



can i use a SMC from 3023 board? i ordered some 3024 donor boards but will take a week to arrive.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: Why do you change <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> without verifying AVREF?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
sorry duke, i meant i've changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>. as this part looked like liquid got there.

i havent measure <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> yet. i do it in the morning.

but i remember i've changed this part before i made this thread because it got corroded .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
[URL="https://mailin.repair/c2-sn0903048.html"]<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>[/URL]

pin1 - 3.418v
​​​​​​​pin3  - 3.418v
​​​​​​​pin4 -  2.5v
​​​​​​​pin5 - 3.387v
pin6 - 3.402v
​​​​​​​pin7 - 3.415v
pin8 - 3.296v


[URL="https://mailin.repair/c2-sn0903048.html"]<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>[/URL] and <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> was corroded when i got the board. they both have been replaced before.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: What is the actual VP0R voltage when measured on the board? Check the same with VD0R. If all voltages are reported low by the SMC it would indicate a AVREF issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
where do you measure VP0R on the board ? 

is it <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>?

pin2 3.32v
pin3, 8.37v
pin4, 8.37v
pin5 4.166v
pin6 0.1v

VD0R will be <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> right?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: pin3 or 4 on both <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>/10. Compare to what SMC is reporting in ASD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
[B]with battery:[/B]

<TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>
pin3 6.82v

<TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR>
pin3 - 0v

ASD hardware profile:
VP0R - 6.916v
VD0R - 0v




[B]with charger & battery:[/B]


<TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>
pin3 7.80v

<TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR>
pin3 - 16.40v

ASD hardware profile:
VP0R - 7.90v
VD0R - 16.40v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: Uhm, isn't this a very discharged or dead battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message:
mm battery was at 20%, now i've charged up fully.



just tried ASD EFI, all passed. why?? how can a low battery caused these two sensor errors?


[img]https://i.imgur.com/GaP9Cu8.jpg[/img]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, POST but sensors failed.
threads.message: Dunno, but a totally discharged battery will pull VP0R under the low limit. Case closed.
